metadata.synopsis: Nerela is wondering whether to sell a music box, the only memento she has of the husband and daughter who were killed by gnolls on the road here. It's a scam - her story is fabricated and the box is a dime a dozen. Player can comfort her or see through her story. Her overall demeanour is weary, fragile (unless you uncover her scam)

62.speaker: Nerela
62.text: I know I need to sell it. I know that.
62.context: NodeContext: Trying to convince herself as much as you.

79.speaker: Nerela
79.text: |Cinematic: She sits with her eyes closed, clutching the music box tightly as it plays.|
79.context: NodeContext: Dismissive. You uncovered her scam and she has no more interest in you.

84.speaker: Nerela
84.text: |Cinematic: The woman sits and hums a mournful tune.|
84.context: NodeContext: Dismissive. You uncovered her scam and she has no more interest in you.

88.speaker: Nerela
88.text: No need for this to get ugly, is there? Bye-bye, now.
88.context: NodeContext: Dismissive. You uncovered her scam and she has no more interest in you.

114.speaker: Nerela
114.text: The one you're travelling with? You're lucky to know them.

115.speaker: Nerela
115.text: Please, I'd... I'd like a moment alone.
115.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lost in thought, holding the box as it's the most precious thing in the world.NodeContext: Sitting

125.speaker: Player
125.text: |Cinematic: The woman cradled a carved wooden box, from which a soft melody chimed.|
125.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lost in thought, holding the box as it's the most precious thing in the world.NodeContext: Sitting

73.speaker: Player
73.context: NodeContext: Weary, remembering how much she had to listen to the song.

96.speaker: Nerela
96.text: Oh, try listening to it a hundred times a day.
96.context: NodeContext: Weary, remembering how much she had to listen to the song.

149.speaker: Nerela
149.text: My husband made it to keep our little monster quiet - traded one headache for another, really.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: Close that box. The music is grating.
100.context: CinematicNodeContext: Closing the music box mid-sentence, cutting music off.NodeContext: Caught by surprise, embarrassed. The last line is her awkward effort at getting you on-side by agreeing with you.

14.speaker: Nerela
14.text: Oh! Of course, how thoughtless. I beg your pardon - I'm not fan of it myself, truth be told.
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Closing the music box mid-sentence, cutting music off.NodeContext: Caught by surprise, embarrassed. The last line is her awkward effort at getting you on-side by agreeing with you.

123.speaker: Nerela
123.text: Said as much to my husband when he made the bloody thing.

8.speaker: Player
8.context: NodeContext: Starting out of a reverie - suddenly embarrassed

136.speaker: Nerela
136.text: Oh! Sorry, I'm just... I'm just listening.
136.context: NodeContext: Starting out of a reverie - suddenly embarrassed

12.speaker: Nerela
12.text: I used to hate this tune - told my husband as much when he made the bloody thing.

132.speaker: Nerela
132.text: But it kept our little monster quiet. Reason to love it if nothing else, trust me.
132.context: NodeContext: A tired and exasperated parent, remembering.

41.speaker: Nerela
41.text: ... how much do you think it's worth? Old Ethel said she'd offer me gold for it.
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: She closes the box and plays her fingers along the lid. Abruptly, she offers it up.NodeContext: Hesitant and suddenly serious, intent on  your response

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Why do you want to sell it?
19.context: NodeContext: A little lost. Remembering something painful.

87.speaker: Nerela
87.text: I... don't have anything else. My husband was carrying our packs when the gnolls found us.
87.context: NodeContext: A little lost. Remembering something painful.

67.speaker: Nerela
67.text: My daughter, sh-she thought they were just big dogs. I tried to get to her... I tried, but-
67.context: NodeContext: Breaking up towards end of sentence, grieving

105.speaker: Nerela
105.text: You must - you must think I'm a monster.  But they say you need coin to enter the city. Bribes.
105.context: NodeContext: Approaching hysteria, doesn't know what to do

24.speaker: Player
24.text: You're no monster. I'm sorry you had to go through that.
24.context: NodeContext: Waving off your sympathy - she's barely holding it together as it is.

95.speaker: Nerela
95.text: You're kind, but I - I can't think about that now. We promised one another we'd get there, whatever it took.
95.context: NodeContext: Waving off your sympathy - she's barely holding it together as it is.

64.speaker: Nerela
64.text: If we... if I don't, it... then they'll have died for nothing.
64.context: NodeContext: Knows it's not logical, but can't dwell on tragedy or she'll break down

43.speaker: Narrator
43.text: *The wood is warped, its joints loose - likely done by assembly in some grim workhouse. You realise she's lying.*

30.speaker: Player
30.text: That box is a cheap trinket - fit only to feed the forge.

50.speaker: Nerela
50.text: All right, fine. This little swindle is meant for soft hearts, not keen eyes.

23.speaker: Nerela
23.text: What's say you take them elsewhere, hm?

116.speaker: Player
116.text: You must be in dire need to lie like that. Here. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

89.speaker: Nerela
89.text: ...seriously? I'll take any fool's coin. Call it charity if it makes you feel better about it.

11.speaker: Nerela
11.text: That's worth a tip, I suppose - if you're looking for the real swindlers here, keep an eye on the children.
11.context: NodeContext: Scorning, spiteful - not giving you the victory.

69.speaker: Nerela
69.text: That lot could give the Thieves' Guild a run for their money.

146.speaker: Player
146.text: That's worth a tip, I suppose - if you're looking for the real swindlers, keep an eye on the children.
146.context: NodeContext: Scornful of the player's decision to hand over money to a desperate refugee running what's been exposed as a scam.

27.speaker: Nerela
27.text: That's worth a tip, I suppose - if you're looking for the real swindlers, keep an eye on the children.
27.context: NodeContext: Scornful of the player's decision to hand over money to a desperate refugee running what's been exposed as a scam.

3.speaker: Nerela
3.text: That lot could give the Thieves' Guild a run for their money.
3.context: NodeContext: Scornful of the player's decision to hand over money to a desperate refugee running what's been exposed as a scam.

21.speaker: Shadowheart
21.text: The next time you want to pay gold to be called a fool, come see me.
21.context: NodeContext: Scornful of the player's decision to hand over money to a desperate refugee running what's been exposed as a scam.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: That was masterful performance. Here. A token of appreciation. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])
72.context: NodeContext: Playing along with you, enjoying your praise

29.speaker: Nerela
29.text: Why thank you. Always nice to have to an appreciative audience.
29.context: NodeContext: Playing along with you, enjoying your praise

51.speaker: Nerela
51.text: Though my little con pales in comparison to the children. Could give the Thieves' Guild a run for their money that lot.

126.speaker: Nerela
126.text: Watch yourself - they're not as kind as I am.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: Lose the sob story. Less is more.

44.speaker: Nerela
44.text: Hm. Noted. But if nuggets of wisdom are all you have to offer...

26.speaker: Nerela
26.text: ... I'll wait for the next idiot with gold, thanks.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: I'm not leaving without that atrocity you call craftsmanship.
94.context: NodeContext: Not entirely afraid of you, but knows she's beaten. It's a game and you've won this round.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: You're not conning anyone else. Hand it over.
20.context: NodeContext: Not entirely afraid of you, but knows she's beaten. It's a game and you've won this round.

1.speaker: Nerela
1.context: NodeContext: Not entirely afraid of you, but knows she's beaten. It's a game and you've won this round.

33.speaker: Nerela
33.context: NodeContext: Not entirely afraid of you, but knows she's beaten. It's a game and you've won this round.

75.speaker: Nerela
75.text: If I had a little coin, I could afford to be self-righteous too. Take it.
75.context: NodeContext: As if the player is making a big deal of nothing.

42.speaker: Nerela
42.text: I'll just find another box and work another idiot. Like always.

45.speaker: Nerela
45.text: I don't... where'd it go? Looks like someone swiped it before you. All that fuss for nothing.
45.context: NodeContext: Extreme edge case where Nerela goes to hand over the box only to discover another player has pickpocketed it first. She's surprised it's gone but sneery and delighted that you don't get it either.

142.text: You're cute. But you're taking up space for the next idiot.

133.speaker: Nerela
133.text: You're cute. But you're taking up space for the next idiot.

36.speaker: Player
36.context: NodeContext: She's flustered. You've just invasively read her mind, and what's more another player his pickpocketed her and taken the box. Still a facade of calm , but just off-kilter and wants you away from her.

25.speaker: Player
25.context: NodeContext: She's flustered. You've just invasively read her mind, and what's more another player his pickpocketed her and taken the box. Still a facade of calm , but just off-kilter and wants you away from her.

80.speaker: Nerela
80.text: Nowhere else to go if he tells. Can't let that happen - just keep calm.
80.context: NodeContext: She's flustered. You've just invasively read her mind, and what's more another player his pickpocketed her and taken the box. Still a facade of calm , but just off-kilter and wants you away from her.

56.speaker: Nerela
56.text: Nowhere else to go if they tell. Can't let that happen - just keep calm.
56.context: NodeContext: She's flustered. You've just invasively read her mind, and what's more another player his pickpocketed her and taken the box. Still a facade of calm , but just off-kilter and wants you away from her.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: If you give me that box I won't expose you.
15.context: NodeContext: She's flustered. You've just invasively read her mind, and what's more another player his pickpocketed her and taken the box. Still a facade of calm , but just off-kilter and wants you away from her.

71.speaker: Nerela
71.context: NodeContext: She's flustered. You've just invasively read her mind, and what's more another player his pickpocketed her and taken the box. Still a facade of calm , but just off-kilter and wants you away from her.

135.speaker: Nerela
135.text: All right, you win. Just... take it.
135.context: NodeContext: She's flustered. You've just invasively read her mind, and what's more another player his pickpocketed her and taken the box. Still a facade of calm , but just off-kilter and wants you away from her.

138.speaker: Nerela
138.text: Gods, look, I don't have it anymore. See? Now take your freakshow elsewhere.
138.context: NodeContext: She's flustered. You've just invasively read her mind, and what's more another player his pickpocketed her and taken the box. Still a facade of calm , but just off-kilter and wants you away from her.

86.speaker: Nerela
86.text: No. No. You do not get to do that.
86.context: NodeContext: Laughing with no humour in it - you'll regret that

5.speaker: Player
5.text: You make all tieflings look bad. Have you no shame?
5.context: NodeContext: Pragmatic, dismissive of your outrage

6.speaker: Nerela
6.text: You can't eat shame, kin. Better to learn that before your belly starts growling.
6.context: NodeContext: Pragmatic, dismissive of your outrage

148.speaker: Player
148.context: NodeContext: Appalled you could even say this, but gives up mock-defiance midway through

134.speaker: Player
134.text: *It's no masterpiece. Her gaze flicks between the box and you. You realise she's lying.*
134.context: NodeContext: Appalled you could even say this, but gives up mock-defiance midway through

110.speaker: Narrator
110.text: *It's no masterpiece. Her gaze flicks between the box and you. You realise she's lying.*
110.context: NodeContext: Appalled you could even say this, but gives up mock-defiance midway through

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *It's no masterpiece. Her gaze flicks between the box and you. You realise she's lying.*
37.context: NodeContext: Appalled you could even say this, but gives up mock-defiance midway through

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Had all of that been a lie?
58.context: NodeContext: Appalled you could even say this, but gives up mock-defiance midway through

47.speaker: Nerela
47.text: What? How did you... no, it wasn't all a lie.
47.context: NodeContext: Appalled you could even say this, but gives up mock-defiance midway through

74.speaker: Nerela
74.text: I do need the coin. The guards in Baldur's Gate aren't going to let us in without a little encouragement.
74.context: CinematicNodeContext: She sighs and her persona changes completely. We've caught on to her scam and she's impatient with us to move on so she can try again.NodeContext: Complete change - more confident, more mocking of us.

32.speaker: Nerela
32.text: Same way you weren't going to stop and listen without a sob story.
32.context: NodeContext: Mocking - not interested in your accusations.

93.speaker: Player
93.context: NodeContext: Indignation - how could you suggest such a thing

17.speaker: Nerela
17.context: NodeContext: Indignation - how could you suggest such a thing

106.speaker: Nerela
106.text: Bah, fine. Let's not waste any more of one another's time, hm?
106.context: NodeContext: Complete change - the scam is up, no point continuing

90.speaker: Player
90.text: You're quite the actor. You almost had me.
90.context: NodeContext: Indignant, how could you suggest such a thing

92.speaker: Nerela
92.context: NodeContext: Indignant, how could you suggest such a thing

140.speaker: Nerela
140.text: All right, fine. One artist knows another.
140.context: CinematicNodeContext: She knows she's been caught and she bows as if accepting your applause.

124.speaker: Nerela
124.text: What can I say? Not much of a tiefling who can't play the victim.

128.text: *You note that it likely isn't worth much, but that she held it as if it was a great treasure.*

63.speaker: Narrator
63.text: *You note that it likely isn't worth much, but that she held it as if it was a great treasure.*

109.speaker: Player
109.text: Take Ethel's offer. Your family would want you to live.
109.context: NodeContext: Convincing herself, putting off a painful moment

9.speaker: Nerela
9.text: You're right. I know that. I just...
9.context: NodeContext: Convincing herself, putting off a painful moment

137.speaker: Nerela
137.text: I'll speak to her. In a little while.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: You don't need to sell it. In fact, I'll pay you not to. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

61.speaker: Nerela
61.text: ... truly? I don't know what to say.

91.speaker: Nerela
91.text: It's easy to forget that there are people like you in the world. Thank you for reminding me.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: It's easy to forget that there are people like you in the world. Thank you for reminding me.

13.speaker: Nerela
13.text: It's easy to forget that there are people like you in the world. Thank you for reminding me.

83.speaker: Shadowheart
83.text: People like you indeed. Idiots, I assume she means.
83.context: NodeContext: Scornful of the player's decision to hand over money to a desperate refugee with a sob story.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: Don't sell the box. I'll get you the money. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
122.context: NodeContext: She's looking around, making a joke of the idea that she can go anywhere.

150.speaker: Nerela
150.text: Well, I suppose I'm not going anywhere. But don't trouble yourself for me, really.
150.context: NodeContext: She's looking around, making a joke of the idea that she can go anywhere.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Sell it? I don't think your 'little monster' would like that.
76.context: NodeContext: Rueful, remembering her daughter's tantrum

65.speaker: Nerela
65.text: No, she would not. Near screamed our ears off when my husband tried to leave it in Elturel.
65.context: NodeContext: Rueful, remembering her daughter's tantrum

48.speaker: Nerela
48.text: We tried to travel light, but... when the gnolls found us, we couldn't... they couldn't run-
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Breaking down into tears as she tries to tell the storyNodeContext: Deep regret, breaking up towards end of sentence

121.speaker: Nerela
121.text: I don't... what else can I do? They say you need coin to enter the city. For bribes.
121.context: NodeContext: Composing herself, trying to be pragmatic

99.speaker: Player
99.text: You've lost so much. I'm sorry.
99.context: NodeContext: Hurt but hiding it - she's just told you something heartbreaking and you've dismissed her trauma.

130.speaker: Player
130.context: NodeContext: Hurt but hiding it - she's just told you something heartbreaking and you've dismissed her trauma.

54.speaker: Nerela
54.text: ... you're right. I'm sure you don't want to listen to my prattling. Sorry.
54.context: NodeContext: Hurt but hiding it - she's just told you something heartbreaking and you've dismissed her trauma.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: It's beautifully crafted. How about I double Ethel's offer? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
60.context: NodeContext: Can't believe it, incredulous at your kindness but not fully trusting it.

77.speaker: Nerela
77.context: NodeContext: Can't believe it, incredulous at your kindness but not fully trusting it.

81.speaker: Nerela
81.text: I'd like to say I don't need the charity, but... just promise me you'll take care of it.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: How about you hang onto it - for safe-keeping.
85.context: NodeContext: Breathless - on the verge of tears and doesn't know what to say.

118.speaker: Nerela
118.text: I... thank you. Just... thank you.
118.context: NodeContext: Breathless - on the verge of tears and doesn't know what to say.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: I'll look after it. Don't worry.
119.context: CinematicNodeContext: She hesitates a moment, eyes flicking from the box to me. She's scamming me, and didn't expect me to actually take the box.NodeContext: Just the slightest hesitation. This is not quite what she expected.

131.speaker: Nerela
131.context: CinematicNodeContext: She hesitates a moment, eyes flicking from the box to me. She's scamming me, and didn't expect me to actually take the box.NodeContext: Just the slightest hesitation. This is not quite what she expected.

57.speaker: Nerela
57.text: Thank you. I hope... I hope it brings you joy.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Thank you. I hope... I hope it brings you joy.

97.speaker: Nerela
97.text: Thank you. I hope... I hope it brings you joy.

66.speaker: Shadowheart
66.text: Next time you feel like wasting gold, I'll happily unburden you of it myself.
66.context: NodeContext: Scornful of the player's decision to hand over money to a desperate refugee with a sob story.

111.speaker: Nerela
111.text: Here. It's no work of art, but I hope -
111.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reaching around to look for the box.

46.speaker: Nerela
46.text: Gods, where is it? Someone's taken it! I'm sorry, I don't know how this happened.
46.context: NodeContext: Confused and hurt. She had little enough left and she's just lost that too.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Don't worry. You can keep the gold.
38.context: NodeContext: Confused and hurt. She had little enough left and she's just lost that too.

144.speaker: Player
144.context: NodeContext: Confused and hurt. She had little enough left and she's just lost that too.

82.speaker: Nerela
82.text: I... of course, I understand. Th-thank you.
82.context: NodeContext: Confused and hurt. She had little enough left and she's just lost that too.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Gold?  That was barely worth a copper.
35.context: NodeContext: Reflective, hedging around something painful

22.speaker: Nerela
22.text: Well... I was hoping for more than that. My husband was carrying all our coin.
22.context: NodeContext: Reflective, hedging around something painful

117.speaker: Nerela
117.text: We... we met gnolls on the road. I got away, but my husband... my daughter-
117.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sobbing, breaking downNodeContext: Breaking down into tears

34.speaker: Nerela
34.text: I'm sorry, I just... I don't know what else to do. They say you need coin to enter the city. For bribes.

53.speaker: Nerela
53.text: Hah. If my husband could hear that.

4.speaker: Nerela
4.text: He built prettier things, but I always told him this was his best work.
4.context: NodeContext: Playful, as if remembering past conversations with her husband.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: What makes this box his best?
40.context: NodeContext: As if sharing a secret with player

49.speaker: Nerela
49.context: NodeContext: As if sharing a secret with player

0.speaker: Nerela
0.text: Casts a silencing spell on little monsters who back talk their parents.

147.speaker: Player
147.context: NodeContext: As if sharing a secret with player

102.speaker: Nerela
102.context: NodeContext: As if sharing a secret with player

129.speaker: Nerela
129.text: Thought you'd come and gloat, did you? Well, piss off - I'm working.
129.context: NodeContext: Irritated, no interest in talking.

141.speaker: Nerela
141.text: Heh. I still can't seem to get that song out of my head.

145.speaker: Nerela
145.text: |Cinematic: She sits with her eyes closed, clutching the music box tightly as it plays.|
